chapter.title: Introduction
chapter.para: Access Control is a client and server authentication and authorization implementation for user and group management.

In the CADC open software repository (https://github.com/opencadc) the Access Control service clients command line are available. This guide explains how to download and run these clients and the available commands. Examples are provided.

warning.para: These access control clients to manage users and groups require the configuration of files ~/.dbrc and ~/config/LdapConfig.properties in the home of the user running the clients. These files contain sensitive and specialistic informations. For this reason these clients are considered administration clients.

chapter.para: This guide provides some simple example on how to use curl client and web broser to perform simple tasks.
